description: 3-mile stretch of white sand fronting major resorts, famous for Black Rock.
family_safety_tips: Stay near Black Rock for snorkeling but watch currents.

description: Sheltered, crescent-shaped bay with calm waters and excellent snorkeling.
family_safety_tips: Very safe for kids due to protected reef.

description: The largest of the three "Kam" beaches with a nice sand spread and showers.
family_safety_tips: Best for swimming; designated lifeguard areas.

description: Slightly smaller beach popular with locals; good for bodyboarding.
family_safety_tips: Watch for shorebreak on high surf days.

description: Famous for its large grassy lawn, playground, and reliable waves.
family_safety_tips: Great for picnics on the grass; waves can be dumpy.

description: Massive, undeveloped golden sand beach with powerful shorebreak.
family_safety_tips: Do not swim if waves are high; notorious for neck injuries.

description: Stunning jet-black sand beach set against green jungle cliffs in a state park.
family_safety_tips: Strong currents and jelly fish; mostly for viewing.

description: Long, wide sandy beach with a protected "Baby Beach" lagoon on the west end.
family_safety_tips: Protected lagoon is very safe; open ocean is rough.

description: World-renowned windsurfing destination; turtles often rest on shore.
family_safety_tips: Do not swim in winter; stay back from turtles.

description: Long, wide sandy beach near the Ritz-Carlton, good for bodyboarding.
family_safety_tips: Shorebreak can be strong; use lifeguard eyes.
